alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 04 at 1:28PM PST until December 05 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST MONDAY... * CHANGES... Extended the warning until Monday afternoon. * WHAT...Heavy snow with a 10-15% chance of lightning. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, except 4 to 18 inches above 7000 feet. Wind gusts up to 45 mph with waves to 4 feet on Lake Tahoe. Sierra ridges gusting up to 90 mph. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions may impact the morning commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Winds and waves could capsize small boats. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lull in activity is expected Sunday evening into the overnight hours on Monday. Additional snowfall will arrive early Monday morning which may impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
